Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; part of lotus bud in added white outline with added red centre; exterior: painted decoration consisting of female figure to left (outstretched arms and hands in outline of figure wearing chiton with dotted paryphe remaining).
Curator's comments: Lemos describes this sherd as belonging to the Group of Worshippers. The leading vase from this group is the St Petersburg chalice from Berezan (Lemos 1991, no. 964). Most of the vases in this group display a mixture of techniques consisting of portraying female figures in outline and dancing komasts in black figure.
On inside pencilled 841 and perhaps a further sign; phi 8 seems less plausible.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 131, p. 291, no. 892, pl. 120)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1118) (phase 2)
